name: trapperjohn
text: A comment left by trapperjohn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by haff, griggs_although, peterjoel)

text: I don't think we've had Molly yet. Or Lie Bot, either.

text:
Lie-Bot's Flow Chart.


Am I telling the truth?
|
V
Yes-------No
| |
V V
Stop it. Continue.

name: awko
text: Damn you formatting!

name: kneejerk
text: Lie bot's flow chart is just the Liar's Paradox.  He just internally repeats the phrase "this statement is false" over and over.

name: gormster
text: STACK OVERFLOW

name: ethelthefrog
text: Do-loop!

name: ted0phile
text: If memory serves, this is the second time you've attempted this sort of thing.

name: awko
text: My problem is that I don't learn from my mistakes.

name: aperson
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: kledermans
text: Is that Frank Zappa in your avatar?  "Sheik Yerbouti"?

name: trapperjohn
text: Indeed it is.  Or I am.

name: madnes
text: His songs are so well conveyed.

name: boheeka
text: The music of Frank Zappa, like Achewood, is nothing short of a life changing phenomenon.

name: boheeka
text: as fanboy-ish as that sounds...

name: kledermans
text: I don't know.  There's actually very little of his stuff that I can listen to without feeling that it's supposed to appeal to people who pride themselves on enjoying music despite of its aesthetic qualities rather than because of them.

name: kledermans
text: And there I meant "in spite of" or "despite", not "despite of".

name: mattsolo
text:
A year later I will reply because ... yeah! As a huge Zappa fan I can see where a person could feel that way. It's definitely not music you listen to because you like pretty music (though he can and did make that, too). Zappa is sort of a musical version of abstract art. You kind of have to cross your eyes and use your imagination to see the naked lady. Some people see it, some don't. Some people like it, some people don't. That said, anyone who likes metal or can appreciate ripping guitars can put together a pretty decent mix tape of Frank, starting with Willie the Pimp. He made a good bit of that, too.

Hooray for diversity!

name: soticoto
text:
Does a shot of Naota with Haruko's Rickenbacker in hand from the end of FLCL talking about abstract art and ripping guitar appreciation count as avatar / comment synergy?
I think it does.

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesler729, pebble, Asinineuser)

name: goosey
text:
I'm sure you mean "why would it be a clutter if his socks are together?"

Cause and effect, man, cause and effect.

name: kledermans
text:
I still haven't seen the one for Lie Bot that people claim exists. Or I must have seen it, since I'm listed has having seen all of them, but I don't remember it. Anyone know where it is?

Also, this may be the second one for Philippe, since his first one was a footnote on Roast Beef's.

name: astro_zombie
text: That was a simpler time for Philippe. He's going through some things now.

name: mobro_4000
text: Circumstances.

name: astro_zombie
text: Those and sharks, yes.

name: anitrophaeron
text: I know there's one for Vlad, who kinda-sorta looks like lie-bot.  Could that be the source of the confusion?  As far as I know there's no lie-bot flowchart.

name: kledermans
text: Yes, that's what I thought too, but nobody confirmed or denied this when I proposed it yesterday.

name: sstralka
text: Just to clarify something that I think somebody pointed out, however obliquely, yesterday:  This is the LIE Bot flowchart we're talking about.  Keyword:  LIE.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text:
But it would be Lie Bot's internal dialog. Does he lie to himself as well, or is it more reasonable to suspect he's truthful in his mind?

One thing is for sure, robots are up to no good.

name: soticoto
text: Keyword: Cake!

text:
He would lie like a rug and fart dust.

Wait.

He would lie like steel decking and fart rivets?

Never mind.
Crap.

B

text:
People may also be mixed up because
the Vlad one featured Lie Bot prominently .

name: slalvation
text: I have never heard anyone claim that there was a Lie Bot flowchart. People uppage were speculating on what it would be like if there was one, and I have seen people wishing that there was one.

Oh, if only hate --> sharks applied to the real world.

Also this is a really weird thing to comment on, but I like the designs of the main logos in the more recent flowcharts for some reason.

name: spinynorman
text:
As a child I, too, labored under the concept that all strangers were somehow drug addicts. To me, rural South Carolina was home to some of the most violent gangland turfware in the history of history, and Kroger's was its headquarters of sin.

Kids are fucked up.

name: spinynorman
text:
Turf warfare came out as turfware, a delightful new sealant container that's organic and Of The Earth.

I have twenty minutes until I can go home and they seem like forever.

name: sargasm
text:
hang in there man

even though... even though this is 8 hours later

name: spinynorman
text: Yeah, now it starts all over again

name: jrpigman
text: Don't worry Phillipe, Vlad loves your mom too... maybe he'll pitch in some money!

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: when you get down to the bare bones, psychology is basically just sharks and moms

name: atmus
text: Sometimes a shark is just a shark though.  You have to watch for that.

name: twoply
text: Perhaps his first memory associated with horribleness is the Jaws ride at Universal Studios. Or it could be just a shark!

name: honesttom
text: We never did find out how his dad died...

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: Sometimes a shark is a card.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: Other times a shark is a pool. But you really have to watch out for card sharks in your pool.

name: overmedicated
text: Loan? Or is that scraping the REAL bottom underneath the secret false bottom of the barrel?

name: lolcatdeluxe
text: Now you are getting into the spirit of it! Loan sharks, white sharks, sharks named "Bruce", they all mean "I don't love my Mom". Oh shiiiiiiiiiit!

name: featurelessvoid
text: Yep, it's all just sharks and moms.  But people get all irritated when you try to jump either one.

name: soticoto
text:
People jump sharks; I jump their mother.
Then I tell them about it.
Repeatedly.

The latter, not the former.
They can jump as many sharks as they like, but they won't deny me the right to remind them I had their mother... and she was gagging for it... but I reckoned her performance was a bit sub-par. Must have been the whole giving birth thing that stretched her as there sure wasn't anything else that wide going in there...


*Coughs*

name: ethelthefrog
text: that is so incredibly true, rolotony.  we all have our own sharks and moms, and the connection between the two is what scares us most.

name: charchar
text: I've always heard Phillipe as speaking in the voice of Flounder from The Little Mermaid . The "SHAAARK" has placed an Official Seal on this in my mind.

name: timmcdivitt
text: do you think chris wants someone to get an "I LOVE MY MOM, AND THAT'S THE DEAL!" tattoo?

name: lateadopter
text: I'm glad this is labeled "Inside the Mind of Philippe."  I thought the decision-making flow-chart for Philippe that appeared in the corner of Roast Beef's was comprehensive and final.  With the minor distinction in title, one need not supplant the other.  I will not have nightmares now.

name: lateadopter
text: Roast Beef wrote in his diary that Philippe's smile had reminded him that Philippe will someday be less than 100% happy, and that children who used to be happy are being kidnapped or drowned in many states at this moment.  He then vomited, possibly under a Nervousness Blanket.  Then he curled up in a corner, facing the wall.

name: doobie
text:
No the Roast Beef smile part is about Philippe not understanding that when you are cheerful towards a depressed person you'll only make them feel guilty and thus even more depressed. Beef's already under a lot of stress and he just can't deal with that right now.

(Besides, Philippe's mouth hasn't been gross for a long time. There's nothing wrong with him!)

name: soticoto
text:
What are you talking about?

Philippe is Five!
And how old was Philippe when his mouth was gross?

text: Five.

name: ttvp
text:
If it makes you feel better, that last one was the Philippe "Decision-making flowchart". Such a thing is not overridden by this one which is simply "Inside the mind of Philippe", with no real bearing on making decisions.

I believe that it would be in many peoples' best interest to realize this distinction with the older and the newer flowcharts. I believe many have not realized this.

name: paperboy_2000
text:
Achewood has been declared the Funniest Web Comic by no less a humor authority than Cracked magazine.
Dig It
Congratulations, Chris! Well deserved.

name: lolcatdeluxe
text:
Indeed, congrats!

I just noticed a bug with the "Discuss" page. The next>> link is active even when there is not a new comic.

It is not a big deal, except for that 2 seconds when I clicked on it thinking "SWEET A NEW COMIC!!!" followed by "NNOOOOOO!!".

Why do they even make Cracked Magazine. And why would people buy it.

NO MORE FLOW CHARTS BECAUSE THIS IS THE GREATEST IT COULD EVER BE.

it'd be downhill from here. christ this was brilliant.

text: I wish we could comment on blog posts, cause beef's latest made my week.

name: goosey
text:
I think the idea is possibly that the blogs are character-blogs and allowing comments would bring it out of character.

Hey! I'd love to see achewood characters commenting on each other's blogs, though. That would be fun. Man that actually sounds awesome!

name: flipper_the_dolphin_bitch

Well, Harvey's just named a cheeseburger after me, so i'm gonna straight up chubby some comments that made me chuckle.

Speaking of which, Chucklebot gets NO love from Onstad these days.
